title: Please bring back Nexus Blitz where I can play any champion and still have fun
body: I don't want to play ranked because people choose blatantly strong champions into what I want play (Ryze, Morde, Kog'maw). I don't want to play SR because 1) people don't take it seriously enough to win 2) same as ranked people pick stupid strong champions into what I play. ARAM should be renamed "Fuck your side, we are giving the cancer shit to the other team". Don't bother telling me to play 3v3. Just bring back Nexus Blitz PLEASE GOD.

You all need to quit begging for Nexus Blitz. They stated the game mode was an alpha test of a new mode, and they were running live tests on the public to see how it runs, how to improve it, etc. The mode _is not complete._ You were playing a prototype version of the game mode. _It is not ready for a full, permanent launch at this time, as it is still in development._ You need to just be patient and wait for the beta version of the mode to be ready for them to implement another test run. But stop expecting them to be able to just drop it in the client like it's a fully functional rotating game mode.

You can't play ANY champion on Nexus Blitz and win, because siege champions dominate almost as hard as they do on ARAM. Now Ascension is a map where anyone can be played to some success, since you don't have to destroy towers in order win the game. This means that everyone has a  shot at doing something and marksmen or siege mages aren't mandatory in order to complete objectives. In addition, Ascension games last an average of 15 minutes and the queues are always super fast.

If you want a fast mode where you can play whoever you like, you should be asking for Ascension.

There indeed are pretty funny 'rotating game modes', as Riot Games calls them.
And then there's Nexus Blitz, which is supposed to become a permanent addition to LoL. I.e. it is not a rotating game mode. I don't understand how it is even possible to read past the intros of Riot Games' articles about it and still not get it.

As for your other complaints: it was in alpha testing, which means it wasn't even rough, but entirely made out of scrap.
Events and buffs need tuning, and players need an explanation as to how the algorithm decides where the event will take place, with possible changes as to how it weighs some values over others. That's comprised in the words "alpha testing", btw.
I was able to pick a lot of different champions with varying degrees of success, but never felt as if one champion's capabilities were undesirable. I carried, was carried, and was wrecked by about every champion of the roster, in both lane and jungle, except perhaps the less popular ones such as Annie, Aurelion Sol, Azir... but that's just my not seeing them often, I suppose.
